pageContext.claim: “Since we passed tax cuts, roughly 3 million workers have already gotten tax cut bonuses — many of them thousands of dollars per worker.”
pageContext.analysis: With about 126 million full-time workers in the United States, only about 3% have received these one-time bonuses. Plus, a Morgan Stanley analysis found that companies are more than three times as likely to allocate the tax savings to buybacks & dividends than labor compensation.
